words.definition: If something is done beforehand, then it is done in advance.
words.example: He packed his luggage beforehand, so he was able to leave right away.

words.definition: If a temperature is centigrade, it is scaled, so water freezes at 0° and boils at 100°.
words.example: The temperature gets as warm as 26 degrees centigrade.

words.definition: To chatter means to talk quickly about unimportant things.
words.example: The children chattered in the back of the classroom.

words.definition: A concerto is music for a solo instrument and played with an orchestra.
words.example: The piano concerto has a section in which only the piano plays.

words.definition: To condense means to make a liquid thicker or a text shorter.
words.example: The reporter condensed the long story into a few sentences.

words.definition: A cove is a part of the coast where the land curves inward.
words.example: They took the boat to a quiet cove for the afternoon.

words.definition: To deteriorate means to become worse.
words.example: The weather conditions deteriorated as the day went on.

words.definition: The exterior is the outside of something.
words.example: The exterior of the house was painted white.

words.definition: A freeway is a fast road where people can travel long distances.
words.example: We took the freeway to get to the city faster.

words.definition: If something is hearty, it is large and satisfying.
words.example: They ate a hearty meal before starting their journey.

words.definition: If someone is hospitable, they are friendly and welcoming to guests.
words.example: The villagers were very hospitable to the travelers.

words.definition: A manor is a large, old house with land around it.
words.example: The king lived in a beautiful manor in the countryside.

words.definition: A monastery is a building where monks live and work.
words.example: The monks spend most of their time praying in the monastery.

words.definition: A nursery is a room for babies or young children.
words.example: The baby was sleeping in the nursery.

words.definition: If something is outstretched, it is stretched out as far as possible.
words.example: He held out his outstretched arms to catch the ball.

words.definition: A parcel is something wrapped in paper so it can be sent by mail.
words.example: The mailman delivered a large parcel to the house.

words.definition: A profile is an outline of something, especially a face, from the side.
words.example: The artist drew a profile of the young woman.

words.definition: If someone is vivacious, they are lively and full of energy.
words.example: Everyone liked the vivacious girl at the party.

words.definition: If something is winding, it follows a curving or twisting path.
words.example: The car drove along the winding mountain road.

words.definition: To zip something means to close it with a zipper.
words.example: She zipped up her jacket because it was cold.
